AFK is handled by the LeaveBuster system that is completely different from the chat system (IFS).  Even if your teammates or the enemies reported you, there will be nothing for the IFS to scan (if you don't type anything toxic) to punish you regardless of how many reports people throw at you.  If you have a clean LeaveBuster record and you afk once, nothing will happen to you.  If you don't have a clean record, you will be punished according to your LeaveBuster meter that is completely unrelated to your 14-day ban.

Yes, Rito has said multiple times that your toxic meter will drop APPROXIMATELY 3 months (I'm assuming it means playing everyday for 1,2 games).  Personally I do not have any issue with using chat at all, but if I feel it will help, try not using chat (unbind the Enter button or drag chat off screen, etc.) for your first 1 month to see if you are comfortable with handling your anger when someone flame you (and someone will).  I think when you get the notification that you will get honor again, it will means your toxic meter has dropped down a level or two (just my speculation, but it makes sense....)
